song.title: This Pub That We Call Home
song.chorus: 'Tis this pub that we call home And from her we oft times may roam But our respite we'll find in a pint maybe nine in this pub that we call home
song.verse: Well allow me to tell ye of a place dear to heart Of each sailor and solier both slobbin and smart Each space in that place is familiar and warm Where each traveler weary retreats from life's storm

Though married but not merry bearing lowly life's load And suffering the chafing my long wedding road Entombed in the womb of this three house and bath Her walls provide shelter from my wife's wicked wrath
In the hours when life sours and I'm weary and beat To the hawking and talking I need to retreat With a pale cup of ale and my good mate's concerns I'm rested yet bleary to the battle return

With a raging of aging in my last breath I crave Please pull up the floorboards and dig me a grave As you rouse and perouse pour an ale on the floor If you listen with care you may hear me cry "more!"
